meanings.definition: To carve or shape (a piece of material) into a sculpture.
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed sculping clay into beautiful shapes.
meanings.sent2: The artist was sculping a figure out of marble.
meanings.sent3: The children were sculping funny faces in the playdough.
meanings.sent4: Her hands moved with precision, sculping the wood like a master craftsman.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor spent hours sculping the details of the statue.

meanings.sent1: His sculping resulted in a stunning piece for the art exhibit.
meanings.sent2: The sculping process requires patience and skill.
meanings.sent3: Watching the sculping demonstration inspired me to try it myself.
meanings.sent4: The sculping class offered a variety of tools for students to use.
meanings.sent5: The museum showcased the history of sculping in different cultures.

meanings.definition: The art or practice of creating sculptures.
meanings.sent1: She studied sculping under a famous artist.
meanings.sent2: The museum featured a special exhibit on the history of sculping.
meanings.sent3: His passion for sculping was evident in every piece he created.
meanings.sent4: The workshop offered classes in painting and sculping.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor's studio was filled with tools for sculping different materials.
